title: The Olympic Rings: Unity in Five Circles
description: Learn The Olympic Rings: Unity in Five Circles in one minute.

hook.text: Five interlocking rings in five colors. Every nation's flag contains at least one of them.

buildup.text: Pierre de Coubertin designed the rings in 1913 to represent the five continents united by sport.

discovery.text: The interlocking design symbolizes connection â€” no continent stands alone.

twist.text: The rings are the most legally protected logo in the world. Using them without permission brings lawsuits.

climax.text: One simple geometric design has represented global unity for over a century.

punchline.text: Five circles. Every nation. That's the power of simplicity.

quiz.question: Why were five specific colors chosen for the Olympic rings?
